body_content.explanation: caused by or likely to suffer from erosion (= damage to soil, stone, etc. by waves, rain, or wind):
examples: Building has been prohibited on the highly erosive areas near the lake.
The fossils were preserved beneath erosive sandstone bases.

body_content.explanation: causing or likely to cause erosion (= damage to soil, stone, etc. by waves, rain, or wind):
examples: Natural erosive forces are causing damage to the building.
If the ice picks up stones and rocks as it moves, it becomes more erosive.

body_content.explanation: (of a disease or medical condition) causing damage to part of the body by gradually rubbing it away :
examples: Erosive inflammatory disease such as arthritis may cause severe pain.
There are a number of possible complications of erosive ear disease.
